title: WCAG 2.1 AA - Color Contrast Ratio Validation (4.5:1 Minimum)
description: Comprehensive automated and manual color contrast testing against WCAG 2.1 Level AA standards. Validates that all text has minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio against background (3:1 for large text 18pt+), and all UI components/graphics have 3:1 contrast. Tests include normal vision, low vision simulation, and color blindness scenarios. Reference: WCAG 2.1 Success Criterion 1.4.3 (Level AA). Target: 100% compliance across all pages.

Test large text (18pt+) has minimum 3:1 ratio
Verify buttons and interactive elements have 3:1 contrast
Use color blindness simulator (Deuteranopia, Protanopia, Tritanopia)
Verify content distinguishable in all color blind modes
Verify focus outline has 3:1 contrast against background
Check error messages and form validation text
Verify error text has sufficient contrast (minimum 4.5:1)

title: OWASP WSTG-ERRH - Error Information Disclosure Prevention
description: Security testing to ensure error messages don't expose sensitive system information, stack traces, database schema details, or internal server paths. Tests intentional error triggering to validate that production error handling is secure and doesn't leak information useful to attackers. Reference: OWASP WSTG-ERRH-01 & ERRH-02. Validates compliance with OWASP ASVS v5.0-7.4 (Error Handling). Critical for preventing reconnaissance attacks.

steps.description: Trigger 500 Internal Server Error by sending malformed JSON to API
Verify response contains generic error message only
Verify NO stack trace exposed in response body or headers
Submit SQL query syntax in form field
Verify NO database error messages (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
Verify 404 response doesn't reveal technology stack
Trigger application exception by invalid file upload
Verify NO server-side file paths exposed
Check browser DevTools Console for errors
Verify NO sensitive environment variables logged
Verify error doesn't reveal if username exists (timing attack prevention)
Review error logs on server (admin access required)
Verify detailed errors logged server-side but NOT sent to client

title: OWASP WSTG-BUSL - Race Condition & Business Logic Testing
description: Tests concurrent operations to identify race conditions that could lead to data inconsistencies, inventory overselling, double payment processing, or other business logic vulnerabilities. Simulates multiple users performing conflicting actions simultaneously. Reference: OWASP WSTG-BUSL-01 (Business Logic). Validates transactional integrity, database locking mechanisms, and idempotency. Critical for financial transactions and inventory management.

steps.description: Set product stock to exactly 1 unit
Open site in 3 separate browser tabs as different users
Simultaneously add product to cart in all 3 tabs
Verify only 1 user can successfully checkout
Verify other 2 users get 'Out of Stock' error
Two users update same donation amount simultaneously
Verify database consistency maintained (no lost updates)
Verify only one transaction created (idempotency check)
Concurrent admin edits on same user record
Verify optimistic locking or last-write-wins notification
Rapid-fire donation submissions (10 requests in 1 second)
Test price manipulation by intercepting and modifying cart total
Verify server-side price validation rejects tampered amount

title: Google Core Web Vitals - LCP, FID, CLS Performance Metrics
description: Comprehensive performance testing aligned with Google's Core Web Vitals metrics that directly impact SEO rankings and user experience. Measures Largest Contentful Paint (visual loading speed), First Input Delay (interactivity responsiveness), and Cumulative Layout Shift (visual stability). Target thresholds: LCP < 2.5s, FID < 100ms, CLS < 0.1. Uses Lighthouse 10+ and real user monitoring. Critical for SEO, conversion rates, and user satisfaction.

steps.description: Run audit on donate page with form interactions
Verify lazy loading doesn't cause layout shift

title: GDPR Article 15 & 17 - Data Portability & Right to be Forgotten
description: Validates GDPR compliance for data subject rights: Right to Data Portability (Article 15) allowing users to export their personal data in machine-readable format, and Right to Erasure/Right to be Forgotten (Article 17) enabling complete data deletion. Tests must verify data completeness in export, permanent deletion within 30 days, and anonymization where deletion isn't feasible (e.g., donation history). Critical for EU operations and avoiding €20M fines.

steps.description: Navigate to Privacy Settings > Download My Data
Verify confirmation email sent within 5 minutes
Check email and click download link
Verify JSON/CSV file downloads containing: personal info, orders, donations, activity logs
Verify file is machine-readable (valid JSON/CSV format)
Navigate to Privacy Settings > Delete My Account
Verify warning message about irreversible action
Verify confirmation email with 7-day cooling off period
Wait 7 days and verify account auto-deleted
Verify user PII purged from database within 30 days
Verify financial records retained per legal requirements but de-identified

title: OWASP WSTG-CONF - Default Credentials & Configuration Testing
description: Security configuration testing to identify default or weak credentials, exposed configuration files, debug modes in production, and insecure server configurations. Checks for .env file exposure, admin/admin credentials, verbose error pages, and unnecessary services running. Reference: OWASP WSTG-CONF-01 through CONF-11. Prevents initial access attacks and lateral movement. Critical for deployment security.

steps.description: Attempt login with default credentials: admin/admin, admin/password, root/root
Check HTTP response headers for verbose information
Verify 'Server' header doesn't expose version (e.g., 'nginx' not 'nginx/1.18.0')
Verify redirect to login page, no dashboard preview
Verify database not accessible from external network
Review robots.txt for sensitive path disclosure
Test for debug mode indicators (console.log, stack traces)
Verify production environment has debug mode disabled

title: WCAG 2.1 AA - Form Labels, Error Suggestions & Input Assistance (3.3.2, 3.3.3)
description: Accessibility testing for form usability ensuring all input fields have programmatically associated labels, clear instructions, and helpful error messages with correction suggestions. Validates WCAG 2.1 Success Criteria 3.3.2 (Labels or Instructions) and 3.3.3 (Error Suggestion). Tests include screen reader compatibility, keyboard-only form completion, and error recovery. title: OWASP WSTG-APIT - API Rate Limiting, Authentication & Authorization
description: Comprehensive API security testing covering rate limiting to prevent abuse, proper authentication mechanisms (JWT validation), and authorization checks ensuring users can only access their own resources. Tests REST API endpoints for OWASP API Security Top 10 vulnerabilities including broken object level authorization (BOLA), excessive data exposure, and lack of resource throttling. Reference: OWASP WSTG-APIT-01 through APIT-05.

title: OWASP Top 10 - Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Prevention
description: Tests for SSRF vulnerabilities where attacker tricks server into making requests to internal resources or external services on their behalf. Common attack vectors: webhook URLs, image fetch URLs, PDF generators, and API integrations. Validates input validation on URLs, allowlist restrictions, and network segmentation. Reference: OWASP Top 10 2021 #10 - Server-Side Request Forgery. Critical for cloud deployments accessing metadata endpoints.

steps.description: Find features that fetch external URLs (webhooks, image imports)

Test private IP ranges: http://192.168.1.1, http://10.0.0.1

Verify application validates resolved IP, not just initial URL
Submit URL with redirect to internal resource
Verify application doesn't follow redirects to internal IPs
Verify only http:// and https:// protocols allowed
Check if webhook endpoints validate destination
Verify webhook URLs restricted to allowlist domains
Review server-side code for URL fetch logic
Verify network segmentation prevents access to internal services

title: Image Optimization - Format, Compression, Lazy Loading & CDN Delivery
description: Comprehensive image performance testing validating Next.js Image component usage, WebP format adoption, responsive image srcset, lazy loading below fold, and CloudFront CDN delivery. Tests image compression quality vs file size trade-offs, proper alt text, and Core Web Vitals impact. Target: Images < 100KB, WebP format for 90% of images, LCP image loads in < 1.5s. Critical for mobile performance and SEO.

steps.description: Navigate to homepage and open DevTools Network tab
Verify 90%+ images served in WebP format
Verify images < 100KB each (exceptions for hero images)

Verify all images have descriptive alt text (accessibility)

Verify LCP image loads in < 1.5 seconds

title: Database Query Performance - N+1 Query Prevention & Indexing
description: Backend performance testing focused on database query optimization. Identifies N+1 query problems where ORM generates excessive queries, validates proper indexing on frequently queried fields, tests query execution time under load, and verifies connection pooling efficiency. Uses MongoDB query profiler and slow query logs. Critical for scalability as user base grows. Target: All queries < 100ms, no N+1 patterns, proper indexes on foreign keys.

steps.description: Navigate to admin dashboard showing donation list
Open MongoDB logs and check queries executed
Verify NO N+1 query pattern (should be 1-2 queries, not 100+)
Verify query uses index (stage: IXSCAN not COLLSCAN)
Verify index exists on: userId, foundationId, createdAt, status
Verify cursor-based pagination used (not offset which degrades)
Run aggregation pipeline for donation statistics
Verify pool size appropriate (min: 1, max: 5 as configured)
Verify no connection pool exhaustion errors

title: Dependency Vulnerability Scanning - npm audit & Snyk Integration
description: Supply chain security testing to identify vulnerabilities in third-party dependencies (npm packages). Automated scanning using npm audit, Snyk, or OWASP Dependency-Check. Validates that no critical/high severity vulnerabilities exist in production dependencies. Tests dependency update process and security patch deployment. Reference: OWASP Top 10 2021 #6 - Vulnerable and Outdated Components. Critical for preventing known exploit attacks.

steps.description: Run npm audit in project root
Verify 0 critical vulnerabilities in production dependencies
Verify core packages within 2 major versions of latest
Install Snyk CLI: npm install -g snyk
Verify Snyk reports no critical vulnerabilities
Verify no GPL/AGPL licenses in production (unless acceptable)
Verify Dependabot config exists and active
Verify patches applied within 7 days of disclosure
Verify lock file committed and up-to-date

title: WCAG 2.1 AA - Keyboard Trap Prevention & Focus Management (2.1.2, 2.4.3)
description: Accessibility testing ensuring users navigating by keyboard alone don't get trapped in any component and can escape using standard keys (Tab, Shift+Tab, Esc). Validates WCAG 2.1 SC 2.1.2 (No Keyboard Trap) and 2.4.3 (Focus Order). Tests modals, dropdown menus, carousels, and custom widgets. Focus must move logically and be visible at all times. Critical for motor impairment users who cannot use a mouse.

steps.description: Navigate to homepage using only keyboard
Press Tab key repeatedly through all interactive elements
Verify focus indicator visible on each element
Open modal dialog (donation form popup if applicable)
Verify focus stays trapped within modal (doesn't escape to page behind)
Verify modal closes and focus returns to trigger element
Verify arrow keys navigate menu items
Verify menu closes and focus returns to menu button
Verify left/right arrow keys navigate slides
Verify user can Tab out of carousel
Verify no keyboard traps in any custom widget

title: Logging & Monitoring - Security Event Detection & Alerting
description: Validates comprehensive security logging covering authentication events (login success/failure), authorization failures, data modifications, and suspicious activity patterns. Tests log completeness, tamper-proofing, retention policies, and alerting thresholds. Reference: OWASP Top 10 2021 #9 - Security Logging and Monitoring Failures. Critical for incident detection, forensics, and compliance (SOC 2, HIPAA). Target: 100% security events logged, alerts within 5 minutes.

steps.description: Verify failed login attempt logged with: timestamp, username, IP address
Try accessing admin endpoint as regular user (401/403 expected)
Verify data modification logged with before/after values
Verify high-severity action logged with admin username
Verify logs stored in tamper-proof location (append-only)
Verify logs retained for minimum 90 days (compliance requirement)
Verify logs centralized for correlation analysis
Verify security team receives alerts within 5 minutes

title: Mobile Responsiveness - Touch Gestures, Orientation & Device Fragmentation
description: Comprehensive mobile testing covering touch target sizes (minimum 44x44px per WCAG), touch gestures (swipe, pinch-zoom), portrait/landscape orientation handling, and testing across device sizes (iPhone SE 320px to iPad Pro 1024px). Validates mobile-first design principles, thumb-friendly navigation, and responsive breakpoints. Tests on iOS Safari and Android Chrome. Critical as 60%+ users access via mobile.

steps.description: Open site on iPhone SE (320x568) in Chrome DevTools mobile emulation
Verify all touch targets (buttons, links) minimum 44x44 CSS pixels
Verify menu opens on tap and closes on outside tap
Verify layout adapts without content cut-off
Verify intermediate breakpoint layout renders correctly
Verify appropriate keyboard types (numeric for phone, email for email)
Check sticky headers/footers on mobile scroll
Verify fixed elements don't cover content
Verify page usable within 5 seconds on 3G

title: Backup & Disaster Recovery - Database Backup, RTO & RPO Validation
description: Business continuity testing validating automated database backups, backup integrity verification, restore procedures, and disaster recovery plan execution. Tests Recovery Time Objective (RTO) - time to restore service, and Recovery Point Objective (RPO) - acceptable data loss window. Simulates catastrophic failures and validates failover mechanisms. Critical for SaaS reliability and customer trust. Target: RPO < 1 hour, RTO < 4 hours.

steps.description: Verify daily incremental backups + weekly full backups
Check MongoDB Atlas backup settings (or equivalent)
Verify restore completes successfully within 30 minutes
Verify all collections, indexes, and data restored correctly
Test incremental restore (restore to specific timestamp)
Verify ability to restore to any point within last 7 days
Verify DR procedures documented and up-to-date
Verify RPO (Recovery Point Objective) < 1 hour data loss
Verify automatic failover to secondary region works

title: End-to-End Smoke Test Suite - Critical Path Validation
description: Comprehensive smoke test covering all critical user journeys in production-like environment. Validates that core functionality works after deployment: user registration/login, product browsing, cart operations, payment processing, donation flow, admin access, and email delivery. Designed for quick validation (< 30 minutes) in CI/CD pipeline before production release. Acts as final gate before go-live decision. Target: 100% critical path success rate.

steps.description: Click 'Sign Up' and register new user
Browse products, add to cart, checkout
Go to donate page, fill form, submit
Verify dashboard loads with real-time stats
Verify receipt email delivered within 2 minutes
Verify < 0.1% error rate in last 24 hours

title: Browser DevTools Application Tab - Comprehensive Storage & Cookie Analysis
description: Deep dive analysis of browser storage mechanisms using Chrome DevTools Application tab. Validates cookies (authentication tokens, consent preferences, session data), localStorage (cart persistence, user preferences), sessionStorage (temporary state), IndexedDB (offline data), Service Workers (PWA caching), and Cache Storage. Tests cookie attributes (HttpOnly, Secure, SameSite), storage quotas, data expiration, and GDPR compliance. Critical for understanding client-side data handling, debugging storage issues, and security auditing.

steps.description: Open Chrome browser and navigate to homepage
Login to trigger authentication cookie creation
Verify cookie has HttpOnly flag = true (prevents XSS access)
Verify cookie has Secure flag = true (HTTPS only)
Verify cookie has SameSite = Lax or Strict (CSRF protection)
Verify cookie expiration timestamp matches session timeout (30 min)
Check for additional cookies (admin-token, consent cookies)
Verify GDPR consent cookie present if accepted
Verify cart data stored: key='cart', value=JSON array
Verify no sensitive data (passwords, payment info) in localStorage
Verify temporary state like form drafts or wizard progress
Verify offline data storage for PWA functionality
Verify service worker registered if PWA enabled
Verify static assets cached (JS, CSS, images)
Test cookie deletion: Clear site data button
Verify logout or session invalidation after cookie deletion
Verify third-party tracking minimized per GDPR
Verify total cookie size < 4KB (browser limit per domain)

title: Frontend Performance - Time Complexity, Space Complexity & Memory Leak Analysis
description: Advanced performance testing analyzing algorithmic time complexity (Big O notation) of frontend operations, space complexity of data structures, and memory leak detection. Tests include: list rendering performance (O(n)), search operations (O(log n) vs O(n)), sorting efficiency, memory consumption growth patterns, event listener cleanup, and garbage collection. Uses Chrome DevTools Performance tab, Memory tab with heap snapshots, and Performance monitor. Critical for scalability, especially with large datasets (10k+ records). Target: O(n log n) or better for sorting, no memory leaks after 5-minute stress test.

steps.description: Navigate to admin dashboard with donation list (seed 1000 records)
Stop recording and analyze flame chart
Verify rendering time scales linearly O(n) not exponentially O(n²)
Test search functionality: search by donor name
Verify search completes in < 100ms for 1000 records
Verify search algorithm is O(log n) if using binary search or O(n) for linear
Test sorting: click column header to sort by amount
Verify sorting time complexity O(n log n) - typical for quicksort/mergesort
Verify sort completes in < 500ms for 1000 records
Perform 100 rapid navigation cycles (home → donate → admin)
Force garbage collection (trash icon in Memory tab)
Compare snapshots: verify memory returns to baseline ±10%
Verify NO memory leaks (detached DOM nodes, event listeners not cleaned)
Open DevTools > Performance monitor (Cmd+Shift+P > Show Performance Monitor)
Monitor for 5 minutes while using site
Verify JS heap size stable (not continuously growing)
Verify DOM nodes count stable (no memory accumulation)
Verify virtualization used (only visible rows rendered)
Verify space complexity O(n) for data storage, O(k) for viewport rendering
Check for React DevTools Profiler (if using React)
Analyze closure memory: check for variables retained in closures
Verify no large objects trapped in closure scope
Verify event listeners removed on component unmount (prevent leaks)

title: Test Execution Tracking & Token Lifecycle - Last Run Detection & Expiry Handling
description: Comprehensive tracking of test execution history and JWT token lifecycle management. Validates which test ran last, test completion timestamps, token expiration detection in real-time, automatic token refresh mechanisms, and graceful degradation when tokens expire mid-test. Tests include: tracking last successful test via localStorage/database, detecting token expiry during test execution, handling 401 Unauthorized responses, re-authentication flow, and test result persistence. Critical for CI/CD pipelines to resume from last checkpoint and for understanding test failures caused by authentication issues.

steps.description: Open Chrome DevTools > Application > Local Storage
Check for test execution tracking keys
Verify key exists: 'lastTestExecuted' with test ID (e.g., 'TC042')
Verify key exists: 'lastTestTimestamp' with ISO 8601 datetime
Login as user and note JWT token creation time
Verify token expiry time = login time + 30 minutes (user token)
Login as admin and check 'admin-token' cookie
Verify admin token expiry = login time + 2 hours
Navigate to profile page and start a long-running operation
Verify API returns 401 Unauthorized status code
Verify error response body: {error: 'Token expired' or 'Unauthorized'}
Check browser console for token expiry message
Verify user redirected to /login page automatically
Set token to expire in 5 minutes (test environment)
Verify token auto-refreshed before expiry (if refresh token pattern used)
Run TC001 and update localStorage: lastTestExecuted = 'TC001'
Run TC002 and update localStorage: lastTestExecuted = 'TC002'
Verify lastTestExecuted updated after each test
Verify test execution history: test_id, status, timestamp, duration
Verify CI/CD can query lastTestExecuted and resume from TC003
Test token expiry during test execution
Start test suite, let token expire mid-execution
Verify test pauses and prompts re-authentication
Verify test suite resumes after re-login from last test
Verify warning shown 5 minutes before expiry: 'Session expiring soon'
Login on browser A, then login on browser B with same user
Verify behavior: single session (B invalidates A) OR multi-session allowed
Admin manually invalidates token (logout all sessions feature)
Verify all active sessions terminated immediately
